data.title: Matt Every Named To The 2006 Ben Hogan Watch List
data.meta_description: University of Florida senior Matt Every (Daytona Beach, Fla.) was named to the watch list for the 2006 Ben Hogan Award on Wednesday for the third time in his four-year
data.text:
University of Florida senior Matt Every (Daytona Beach, Fla.) was named to the watch list for the 2006 Ben Hogan Award on Wednesday for the third time in his four-year career. The winner of the nation's top collegiate golf award will be announced on May 13, 2006 at the Colonial Country Club prior to the start of the Bank of America Colonial.

Every made headlines last summer when he tied for 28th-place at the U.S. Open in Pinehurst, N.C. He was also a part of the United States Walker Cup team that defeated Great Britain & Ireland at the Chicago Golf Club in August. Every currently leads the Gators with a 71.47 stroke average and has placed in the top-five at five of the team's seven tournaments, including a third-place finish at the Puerto Rico Classic this week. He won the Gators' season-opener at the Inverness Invitational by carding a three-round score of 213 (E) for his fourth career individual medal.

The Hogan Award is presented annually to the top men's golfer in NCAA Division I, II, III, NAIA or junior college, taking into account all collegiate and amateur competitions during the last 12 months. The selection committee will announce 10 semi-finalist on March 29 and name three finalist on May 2. The three finalist will attend The Hogan Award banquet on Saturday May 13 at the Colonial Country Club. The Gators will continue their season March 10-12 at the Southern Highlands Intercollegiate in Las Vegas, Nev.

2006 The Ben Hogan Award Watch List

(In Alphabetical Order)

Ryan Blaum, Duke

Scott Brown, South Carolina-Aiken

Dane Burkhart, South Carolina-Aiken

Clay Ogden, Brigham Young

Kyle Reifers, Wake Forest

Webb Simpson, Wake Forest

-UF-
